title: Variables
summary: Variables are named containers that store values in a program so you can reuse or change them later. They help make code readable and maintainable.
sample_question: What is a variable and why is it useful?

title: Loops
summary: Loops let you repeat a block of code multiple times without rewriting it. For loops are used when you know how many times to repeat; while loops repeat until a condition becomes false.
sample_question: Explain the difference between a for loop and a while loop.

title: Conditionals (if-else)
summary: Conditionals let your program make decisions based on true or false conditions. They allow different code to run depending on input or situations.
sample_question: What is an if-else statement and when would you use it?
